alert.note: Alert for Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 2:14PM CDT until May 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS... .A strong cold front will approach northern Nebraska midday Thursday. South of the front, gusty westerly winds will combine with relative humidity of 10 to 15 percent. This will lead to critical fire weather conditions across the area. As the cold front passes from north to south across the Sandhills into southwestern Nebraska, an abrupt change in wind direction to the north is expected. Northerly winds behind the front of 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph are likely. The main fire weather concerns in zones 204 and 206 will be along and south of highway 2 from Antioch to Dunning. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CDT /11 AM MDT/ TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL AND WESTERN SANDHILLS...AS WELL AS SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity which is in effect from noon CDT /11 AM MDT/ to 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ Thursday. * Affected Area...In NEZ204...Fire Weather Zone 204 Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR. In NEZ206...Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest. In NEZ210... Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. In NEZ219...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. The main area of concern in zones 204 and 206 is along and south of highway 2 from Antioch to Dunning. * Winds...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Winds will abruptly shift behind a cold front to the north at 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 to 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires which may develop will have a high probability for rapid spread and may be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
